Solutions to homework Week 1 Problem 1 To compare the two funds, we assume that equal investments of \(X\) are made at time 0. John’s accumulation function is \[t^2+2t+1\] Edna’s accumulation function is \[2t^{2}+1\] To determine when Edna’s investment exceeds John’s, we set: \[ X(2t^{2}+1)>X(t^{2}+2t+1)\] which reduces to: \[t^{2}-2t>0\] or \[t(t-2)>0\] Thus, Edna’s fund exceeds John’s after 2 years.
